attributes.action: Urgent Govertment enquiry needed into delays in reclaiming care fees from Primary Care Trusts
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently thousand of claimants throughout the UK, who submitted claims to NHS Primary Care Trusts claiming residential care homes for people with Alzeimers and Parkinsons. -  which should have been paid by the NHS.

Deadlines were given by the PCTs for submission of  claims - now some PCTs state it could be up to 5 (FIVE) years before claims are assessed.

People were forced into taking out deferred loans against their property with their Local Authorities to pay for their care - repayable when property is sold.

Some local authorities are charging 8 (EIGHT) % per annum -   they are not interest free.

Why are these claims against the PCT for care taking so long?

Why are some local authorities charging 8%
for loans to cover the cost of care?

Both of these issues need very very urgent
enquiry and investigation by the relevant Government Minister.
